intro: Ainsliaea sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, butterfly-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is known for its delicate, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Ainsliaea sparsiflora thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections.
